sentences.en: By contrast the mood has brightened at the more mature end the newsstand.
sentences.cn: 与此相反地,杂志摊上更成熟的读物却生意兴隆.

sentences.en: Eight new national newspapers have appeared on the newsstands since 1981.
sentences.cn: 自1981年以来，有八家全国性报纸已在报摊上有售。

sentences.en: For generations, Time and Newsweek fought to define the national news agenda every Monday on newsstand.
sentences.cn: 每周一的报摊上, 《时代周刊》与《新闻周刊》都会以封面文章来争领时事焦点.这种情形已延续了一代又一代.

sentences.en: Hey - hey! And then to top it off, I walked to the newsstand.
sentences.cn: 嗨!嗨! 然后一切结束了我走向报亭.

sentences.en: I buy a magazine at a newsstand.
I buy newspapers at the newsstand.
I'll go to the newsstand now and pick one up.
National newsstand buyers and subscribers should be getting it next week.
sentences.cn: 全国报摊购买者和用户应该得到它下周.

sentences.en: On his way home he stops at a newsstand and buys a paper.
sentences.cn: 在回家的路上,他停在报摊前,买了份报纸.

sentences.en: Scene: A Street: Monica and Phoebe are walking to newsstand.
sentences.cn: 场景: 街道: 莫妮卡和菲比走向报摊.

sentences.en: The newsstand a wide selection of newspapers and magazines.
sentences.cn: 报刊亭有各种报纸和杂志可供选择.

sentences.en: Trends Esquire display in newsstand in an impressive and eye - catching way.
sentences.cn: 《时尚先生》在报摊亭的醒目摆放,强烈吸引读者眼球.

sentences.en: We met at the newsstand . We both grabbed for the last Field and Stream.
sentences.cn: 我们刚刚在报摊认识我们都买了“原野与河流”

sentences.en: You can buy it at newsstand.

trans.tran_en: A newsstand is a stall in the street or a public place, which sells newspapers and magazines
